items.title: Fokker-Planck Equation for the Kinetic Operator
items.content:
433: :label: prop-fokker-planck-kinetic
434: 
435: Let $\rho(x,v,t)$ be the probability density of a single walker at time $t$. Under the kinetic SDE ({prf:ref}`def-kinetic-operator-stratonovich`), $\rho$ evolves according to:
436: 
437: $$
438: \partial_t \rho = -v \cdot \nabla_x \rho - \nabla_v \cdot [(F(x) - \gamma v) \rho] + \frac{1}{2}\sum_{i,j} \partial_{v_i}\partial_{v_j}[(\Sigma\Sigma^T)_{ij} \rho]
439: 
440: $$
441: 
442: **Key Terms:**
443: 
444: 1. **Transport:** $-v \cdot \nabla_x \rho$ (position advection by velocity)
445: 2. **Drift:** $-\nabla_v \cdot [(F(x) - \gamma v)\rho]$ (force and friction)
446: 3. **Diffusion:** $\frac{1}{2}\text{Tr}(\Sigma\Sigma^T \nabla_v^2 \rho)$ (thermal noise)
